latin_text: Forsan et haec olim meminisse iuvābit.
english_translation: Perhaps one day it will be pleasing to remember even this.
author: Virgil
notes: Spoken by Aeneas to his men to comfort them during a storm.

author: Julius Caesar
notes: Said upon crossing the Rubicon river, starting a civil war.

english_translation: Can there be such great anger in heavenly minds?
author: Virgil
notes: The opening lines of the epic, questioning Juno's wrath.

english_translation: Let them hate, so long as they fear.
author: Lucius Accius
notes: A famous line from a tragic play, often attributed to the emperor Caligula.

latin_text: Carpe diem, quam minimum crēdula posterō.
english_translation: Seize the day, trusting as little as possible in the next.
author: Horace
notes: A famous exhortation to live in the present.
